channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 'Free Palestine' Grafitti on wall near Church Lane, 26th June
item.description:
There is a spray paint 'Free Palestine' Grafitti on a wall on Barnwood Road near Church Lane. It needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 189, Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 26th June
item.description:
Customer reported that they have had a barn fire. A loss adjustor and building expert have visited and recommended having the PROW temporarily closed while it's sorted out as there is a slight risk of Asbestos and the structural integrity of the barn is unstable making the path dangerous
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lorrys have caused dents and telephone box now leaning, 26th June
item.description:
Lorrys have caused dents to pathway and telephone connection box now leaning. There are dents in the pathway in front of the telephone box which is now leaning forward due to heavy vehicles on the pathway due to a house extension. The divits are so deep the rain collects in them. Issue is ongoing and getting worse everyday due to lorrys parking on the path. Issue is by number 2 Carmarthen Road - Hatherley which is by the house being renovated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Caernarvon Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: TMC - Defects -other CW10 problem, 26th June
item.description:
CWED 1200 X 400X 40mm MARKED AS NUMBER 2 STANDARD TM 15MDB NARROW ROAD (CW10 Edge Deterioration)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long deep gouge in road, 26th June
item.description:
Long gouge in road where a cable repair has been re-tarmaced and it has worn badly, lasts at least 5 metres, possibly 10, Very unsafe for cyclists, as I was very close to being thrown off as it caught my wheels up. on the side heading towards Bath Road shops, just before Morrend Rd.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Southcourt Drive, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 26th June
item.description:
Customer reporting multiple outage in Cheltenham - at least 4 sets are not working and vehicles are dashing the lights
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles
